H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H5057.def: = a person in a position of high authority over a nation, a division of priests or levites, or an army

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H3967.def: = state in which a countable entity is one hundred in number

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H6555.def: = process by which a container bursts open due to abundance of contents

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others

H3881.def: = man and tribe; ◄ third son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, later responsible for temple duties

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H4054.def: = open land with enough grass and plants to graze cattle or flocks of sheep and goats

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H727.def: = relatively large wooden box ► used for storage

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7586.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Kish<SDBH:קִישׁ>}; tribe of {L:Benjamin<SDBH:בִּנְיָמִן>}; ► first king of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3474.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects to be without curve or bend and/or have an even or regular surface

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H41.def: = man; ◄ from {L:Kiriath-Jearim<SDBH:קִרְיַת יְעָרִים>}; ► father of {L:Ahio<SDBH:אַחְיֹו>} and {L:Uzza<SDBH:עֻזָּא>}/{L:Uzzah<SDBH:עֻזָּה>}

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H3658.def: = musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing

H5035.def: = container ◄ made of a goatskin, the outer side of which has been turned inside; ► used for storing wine

H8596.def: = musical instrument, consisting of a membrane, usually of animal skin, which was stretched over a shallow circular, triangular, or square frame; ► it was struck sharply with one or two hands, depending on where it was situated; it could be held in one hand, under the arm, or against the chest and struck with the other hand, or it could be held on the knees or the ground and struck with one or two hands; the fingers of one hand could be used to tighten or loosen the tension on the membrane as it was struck

H4700.def: = paired round thin metal plate-like objects ► struck together to produce a loud crashing sound as part of musical accompaniment

H2689.def: = tubular or conical wind instrument with flared mouth and bright penetrating ringing tone; ◄ made out of metal; ► used for giving signals and during festivals and celebrations

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H1637.def: = level, circular area about 7.5 to 12 meters in diameter, where people threshed their grain; usually located near the fields where the grain was grown, and if possible, in an elevated area that was exposed to the breeze

H3592.def: = a type of short {L:spear<SDBH:רֹמַח>} or large {L:arrow<SDBH:חֵץ>}, made of wood or reed, and therefore relatively light and more suited for throwing from a standing position or while riding on a horse or in a chariot

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose
